intro: Athanasia speciosa, commonly known as the sacred flame plant, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its vibrant red and orange tubular flowers that resemble flames. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, glossy surface and a woody stem that can grow up to several feet in height. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Athanasia speciosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
